intro: Phyllanthus capillaris, commonly known as the slender leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its structure includes a short stem with opposite leaves, and it produces tiny, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Phyllanthus capillaris is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
